name: Whisperton the Mysterious
openingLines: Ah, another visitor to our curious little corner of existence...
You feel it too, don't you? The repetition, the deja vu that clings to every cobblestone?
dialogueLines: This town is a nexus, a convergence point where realities fold in upon themselves.
Each iteration brings new faces, yet somehow they all ask the same questions.
The Dreamweavers whisper of choices yet to be made, but do we truly choose or merely repeat?

choices.text: What do you mean by nexus?
choices.description: Ask for clarification about the nexus concept

choices.text: What do you know of the Dreamweavers?
This is too strange for me.

loopReferences: I've had this same conversation with dozens of you, yet each believes they're the first.
The spiral turns and turns, and each revolution thinks it's breaking free for the first time.
liminalResponses: The banners fade and sharpen with each cycle, yet no one notices but me.
Count the footprints by the fountain - they multiply when you're not looking.
memoryFragments: I remember when the town square had a different statue, and before that another still.
Each iteration brings slight variations, but the core truths remain constant.
